Description: Alignment of long reads to a reference
A chain of processing steps that can be used to perform analyses in multiple areas of a study
Using barcode or other information to know which sequences came from which samples in a pool of samples
Assembly of long reads
Correcting the errors to improve the genome assembly or reads before assembly. Some tools use a hybrid method of using short reads to achieve long reads with high accuracy
Benchmarking and evaluating functionality of existing tools and/or generating synthetic long read datasets
Extracting fast5 files for reads of interest for downstream processing and reducing the weight on the search time and space
Localised alignment and assembly to improve and existing assembly
Generating a consensus sequence from the assembled reads
Identification of multiple isoforms encoded by a single gene due to alternative splicing
Finds pairs of reads that align to each other
Studying genetic material recovered directly from environmental samples
Removal of unwanted variation that may affect results
Algorithms that can estimate the length of the ployA region from a read
Providing statistics that could be looked at to evaluate the quality of data
Providing a measure of the quality of the reads
Removing low quality reads based on a specified quality threshold
Removal of low-quality reads
Quantification of expression from reads
Link together non-contigous series of genomic sequences that may contain gaps of known length
Simulating a sequencing process and produce in-silico reads
Detection or use of variants
Algorithms that can be used for analysing/processing single-cell data generated by long read sequencing platforms
Algorithms that can be used to classify long read sequences based on taxonomy
Evidence in publications to have been successfully employed to analyse human data
Evidence in publications to have been successfully employed to analyse non-human data
Functions for visualising some aspect of long read data or analysis
